abstract: Senate votes 62-37 to back Pres Obama in his deal to link 12 nations into ambitious trade accord known as Trans-Pacific Partnership, but but bill faces perilous path in the House; measure, which gives Obama and succeeding president 'trade promotion authority,' is opposed not only by House Republicans but Democrats as well.
lead_paragraph: Senator Mitch McConnell aligned with the president to push the deal, which would link 12 nations on either side of the Pacific into a trading bloc and expand the president’s trading authority. The legislation still requires House approval.

headline.main: Senate Vote Is a Victory for Obama on Trade, but a Tougher Test Awaits
headline.print_headline: Senate Vote Is a Victory for Obama on Trade, but a Tougher Test Awaits

snippet: Senator Mitch McConnell aligned with the president to push the deal, which would link 12 nations on either side of the Pacific into a trading bloc and expand the president’s trading authority. The legislation still requires House approval.
